channel.itunes:author: Kevin Upthegrove
channel.itunes:subtitle: Notes on rum, a few minutes at a time.
channel.itunes:summary: Notes on rum, a few minutes at a time. Exploring rum as a spirit as well as an ingredient in both new and classic tiki cocktail recipes. Rum not included.

item.title: Episode 29: R.L. Seale 10-year Barbados rum
item.dc:creator: Kevin Upthegrove
item.description:
5 Minutes of Rum episode 29: R.L. Seale 10 year Barbados rum, cracking the spine of Potions of the Caribbean, and the Pupule.

Episode links:

Diffordsguide, Foursquare Distillery
Diffordsguide, R. L. Seale 10-year rum
Ministry Of Rum, Foursquare Distillery
R. L. Seale 10-year rum, Inu A Kena review
Potions of the Caribbean, from Cocktail Kingdom
Pimento dram recipe from episode 15 of 5 Minutes of Rum
Cinnamon syrup, from episode 16 of 5 Minutes of Rum

 

Pupule
3 oz gold Barbados rum (R.L. Seale 10 year) - note the original recipe calls for gold Virgin Islands rum
1/2 oz fresh lime juice
1/2 oz fresh orange juice (may as well make it fresh since you’ll be using the peel of an orange for the garnish)
1/4 oz Don’s Spices #2 (equal parts vanilla syrup and pimento dram)
1/4 oz cinnamon syrup/Don’s Spices #4
2 dashes Angostura bitters/Don’s Dashes #8
1 cup of crushed ice

Combine all the ingredients in a spindle blender and blend for 5 seconds. Pour unstrained into a double old-fashioned glass with either 1 large ice cube or half-full with standard ice cubes. Garnish with a long spiral cut orange peel wrapped around the inside of the glass.
item.itunes:author: Kevin Upthegrove
item.itunes:subtitle: R.L. Seale 10 year Barbados rum, cracking the spine of Potions of the Caribbean, and the Pupule.
item.itunes:summary: R.L. Seale 10 year Barbados rum, cracking the spine of Potions of the Caribbean, and the Pupule.

item.title: Episode 28: Angostura 1919 rum
item.dc:creator: Kevin Upthegrove
item.description:
5 Minutes of Rum episode 28: Angostura 1919 rum,  The Drunken Botanist, Angostura bitters, and the 2070 Swizzle.

Episode links:

Angostura rum
Angostura 1919 rum
Angostura bitters
Find. Eat. Drink.: Angostura guide
Angostura Rums Distillery Visit - Alcademics
The Drunken Botanist 
Martin Cate + 2070 Swizzle, from The Atomic Grog 
Zaya rum (Trinidad base), E16
Plantation Original Dark rum (Trinidad rum) E19

2070 Swizzle
1 oz Angostura 1919 rum
1 oz Lemon Hart 151 rum
1/2 oz lime juice
1/2 oz simple syrup
1/2 oz honey mix
1/4 oz pimento dram
4 drops Pernod
2 dashes Angostura bitters

Combine all ingredients in the metal mixing cup of a spindle blender and add 1/2 cup crushed ice (last). Mix for 5 seconds and pour unstrained into a collins glass. Add more crushed ice to fill. As an alternate preparation, combine all ingredients directly into the collins glass filled with crushed ice. Swizzle by hand until blended, top off with more crushed ice, and continue to swizzle until the outside of the glass frosts over. Garnish with freshly grated nutmeg.
item.itunes:author: Kevin Upthegrove
item.itunes:subtitle: Angostura 1919 rum, The Drunken Botanist, Angostura bitters, and the 2070 Swizzle
item.itunes:summary: Angostura 1919 rum, The Drunken Botanist, Angostura bitters, and the 2070 Swizzle

item.title: Episode 27: Ron Barcelo Anejo
item.dc:creator: Kevin Upthegrove
item.description:
5 Minutes of Rum episode 27: Ron Barcelo Anejo, making ginger syrup, and the Hispanola.

Episode links:

Cap Haitien Rum and Honey

How to pronounce cachaca

Ron Barcelo official site

Ron Barcelo Anejo (official site)

The Rum Howler Blog (Ron Barcelo Anejo review)
 

Hispanola

1 1/2 oz Ron Barcelo Anejo
1 1/2 oz Rhum Barbancourt (4 or 8)
1/2 oz fresh lime juice
1/2 oz fresh lemon juice
1 oz ginger syrup
1/2 oz orange curaçao
1/4 oz falernum
Shake with ice cubes and strain into a double old-fashioned glass with crushed ice. Garnish with a stick of fresh ginger. 


Ginger syrup
Take a piece of fresh ginger that’s about 2-4 ounces and cut it into slices. Put that in a saucepan with a 1:1 ratio of sugar and water; 1 cup of each. Bring that mix to a boil over low heat until the sugar is dissolved. Cover and let it simmer for 2 minutes. Then take it off the heat and let it sit covered for 1-2 hours, depending on how strong a flavor you want. Strain and bottle and add 1/2 oz silver rum to help stabilize. 
This recipe can be scaled down as necessary. The syrup stays viable for a lengthy period of time as long as it's refrigerated, but it'll gradually lose flavor (this is not desired).
item.itunes:author: Kevin Upthegrove
item.itunes:subtitle: Ron Barcelo Anejo, making ginger syrup, and the Hispanola.
item.itunes:summary: Ron Barcelo Anejo, making ginger syrup, and the Hispanola.

item.title: Episode 26: Rhum Barbancourt 8
item.dc:creator: Kevin Upthegrove
item.description:
5 Minutes of Rum episode 26: Rhum Barbancourt 8, Sippin’ Safari, and the Port au Prince.

Episode links:

The Atomic Grog
Barbancourt rhum
Barbancourt 5 star
LATimes article on Haiti (post 2010 earthquake) 
Falernum (5 Minutes of Rum E11) 
Amber Virgin Islands rum, grenadine (5 Minutes of Rum E14) 
Pilsner glass (Bed, Bath & Beyond - I reference Cost Plus in the show but I couldn't find the ones I had purchased there)
Sippin’ Safari (Amazon)
Port-au-Prince

Port au Prince (from Sippin’ Safari)
1/2 oz fresh lime juice
1/2 oz unsweetened pineapple juice
1/2 oz falernum
1/4 oz sugar syrup
3/4 oz Barbancourt 5 Star (8 year)
3/4 oz gold Virgin Islands rum (Cruzan)
Dash Angostura bitters
1/8 tsp (6 drops) of grenadine
4 oz (1/2 cup) crushed ice

Combine everything in a spindle blender, adding ice last. Blend for 5 seconds. Pour unstrained into a Pilsner glass. Garnish with a mint sprig.
item.itunes:author: Kevin Upthegrove
item.itunes:subtitle: Rhum Barbancourt 8, Sippin’ Safari, and the Port au Prince
item.itunes:summary: Notes on rum, a few minutes at a time. Exploring rum as a spirit as well as an ingredient in both new and classic tiki cocktail recipes. Rum not included.

item.title: Episode 25: Plantation 3 Stars
item.dc:creator: Kevin Upthegrove
item.description:
5 Minutes of Rum episode 25: Plantation 3 Stars white rum and the Admiral’s Grog

Episode links:

Plantation 3 Stars
Plantation 3 Stars on Difford’s guide
Plantation Original Dark (5 Minutes of Rum E19)
El Dorado 8 (5 Minutes of Rum E24)
Beachbum Berry Remixed 
Spice syrup blog post
Pimento dram (5 Minutes of Rum E15)
Dictionary of Royal Slang
British Royal toasts

The Admiral's Grog

1 oz Plantation 3 Stars rum (white caribbean rum)
1 oz Plantation Original Dark rum (dark caribbean rum)
1 oz El Dorado 8 (Demerara rum)
1 oz honey mix (50-50 mix of honey and water)
3/4 oz fresh lime juice
3/4 oz fresh white grapefruit juice*
3/4 oz black tea
1/4 oz pimento dram

Combine all ingredients in a cocktail shaker and shake with ice cubes. Strain into a double old-fashioned glass filled with crushed ice. Garnish with mint and a spent lime shell. Optionally, augment with a sugar stick. Raise your glass and toast to absent friends.

* If you don't have a fresh white grapefruit to juice, use bottled or canned unsweetened white grapefruit juice and add a dash of grapefruit bitters.
item.itunes:author: Kevin Upthegrove
item.itunes:subtitle: Plantation 3 Stars white rum and the Admiral’s Grog
item.itunes:summary: Notes on rum, a few minutes at a time. Exploring rum as a spirit as well as an ingredient in both new and classic tiki cocktail recipes. Rum not included.

item.title: Episode 24: El Dorado 8
item.dc:creator: Kevin Upthegrove
item.description:
5 Minutes of Rum episode 24: El Dorado 8, spindle mixers and The Sea of Cinn.

Episode links:

The Quiet Village podcast
ZenTikiLounge podcast
Guyana
El Dorado
El Dorado 8 product page
El Dorado 8 review from Mountain of Crushed Ice
El Dorado 5 on 5 Minutes of Rum (E8)
Cinnamon syrup 5 Minutes of Rum E16
Honey mix 5 Minutes of Rum E6
Waring Spindle mixer (Amazon)
Sippin’ Safari (Amazon)
Total Tiki app (iTunes)
Martin Doudoroff (designer of Total Tiki app)

Sea of Cinn
2 oz Demerara rum (El Dorado 8)
1 oz lime juice
1/2 oz cinnamon syrup
1/2 oz honey mix
1/2 oz Lemon Hart 151
Combine all ingredients with 1 cup of crushed ice and blend in a spindle mixer for 5 seconds. Pour unstrained into a tiki mug or double old-fashioned glass. Garnish with a swizzle stick.

item.title: Episode 23: Ron Zacapa 23
item.dc:creator: Kevin Upthegrove
item.description:
5 Minutes of Rum episode 23: Zacapa 23, Bittermens Mole bitters, and a Three-Rum Old Fashioned.

Episode links:

Ron Zacapa
Zacapa 23
Bittermen's Mole bitters
Three-rum Old Fashioned recipe from serious eats
The Franklin Mortgage & Investment Co.
Angostura bitters
Appleton 12 year: E7
Demerara syrup: E8
Smith & Cross: E15
Large ice cube molds

Three-Rum Old Fashioned

1 ounce Appleton Estate Reserve rum (Appleton 12 here)
1/2 ounce Ron Zacapa 23
1/2 ounce Smith and Cross rum
1 teaspoon rich demerara syrup
2 dashes Angostura bitters
1 dash Bittermen's Mole bitters
Fill a mixing glass 1/2 - 2/3 full with ice. Add the rum, demerara syrup, and both bitters. Stir with a bar spoon until very cold - about 30 seconds. Strain into a rocks glass with either fresh ice cubes, or 1 large ice cube. Garnish with an orange peel. 

In this episode I made a a variant using 1 ounce of Zacapa 23 and 1/2 ounce of Appleton 12. Recommended.
item.itunes:author: Kevin Upthegrove
item.itunes:subtitle: Zacapa 23, Bittermens Mole bitters, and a Three-Rum Old Fashioned

item.title: Episode 22: Koloa 2 - Dark, Spice, and Coconut.
item.dc:creator: Kevin Upthegrove
item.description:
5 Minutes of Rum episode 22: 3 more Kōloa rums and 3 cocktails.

Episode links:

Kauai

Kōloa

Kōloa Dark

Kōloa Kauai Spice Hawaiian Rum

Kōloa Coconut Hawaiian Rum

Inu A Kena coconut rum challenge

Inu A Kena review - Kōloa Coconut Rum review

Tahitian Vanilla Bean syrup (A Mountain of Crushed Ice)

Beachbum Berry Remixed

Sprindrift Jr.
3/4 oz orange juice
3/4 oz fresh lemon juice
1/2 oz passion fruit syrup (episode 3!)
1/4 oz vanilla syrup
1 1/2 oz Kōloa Dark rum (originally Demerara rum)
Combine all ingredients and shake well. Pour unstrained into a tiki mug or tall glass. Add more ice to fill as needed. Garnish with mint.

Captain Vadrna's Grog
2 1/2 oz Kōloa Spiced rum
1/2 oz white grapefruit juice (fresh if available)
3/4 oz fresh lime juice
3/4 oz demerara syrup (E9!)
ash of Angostura bitters
Shake well with ice and our unstrained into a double old-fashioned glass. Garnish with lime wedge and a cinnamon stick.

Waiʻaleʻale
1 oz Kōloa Coconut rum
1 oz Gold Barbados rum (Plantation 5 year)
3/4 oz fresh lime juice
1/2 oz orange curaçao (Pierre Ferrand Dry Curaçao)
1/2 oz simple syrup
1/2 oz vanilla syrup
1 tsp. pimento dram
Combine all ingredients in a cocktail shaker and shake with ice cubes. Pour unstrained into a coconut mug or a double old-fashioned glass. Garnish with a lime wheel.

item.title: Episode 21: Kirk and Sweeney 12 Year.
item.dc:creator: Kevin Upthegrove
item.description:
5 Minutes of Rum episode 21: Kirk and Sweeney 12 Year Dominican rum and the Beachcomber’s Gold cocktail.

Episode links:

35 Maple Street
Kirk and Sweeney 12 Year
Inu a Kena Kirk and Sweeney review
Beachbum Berry Remixed

Beachcomber’s Gold (Hollywood and Palm Springs)
Recipe circa 1937 (Hollywood) and 1950s (Palm Springs)
1/2 oz fresh lime juice
1/2 oz simple syrup
1 oz gold Puerto Rican rum (Kirk and Sweeney 12 year)
1/4 oz gold Jamaican rum (Appleton VX)
1/4 oz dark Jamaican rum (Coruba)
6 drops Pernod
4 drops almond extract
2 oz (1/4 cup) crushed ice
Add all ingredients to a mixing cup and blend. Strain into a champagne saucer or cocktail glass. Don’s presentation included an ice shell, which I’m not attempting at this time. 

 

Note: Yes, I mis-spoke early in the episode and said 12 months when I meant 12 years. I regret the error, but an edit seemed over the top.

item.title: Episode 20: Kōloa White and Gold Hawaiian Rum
item.dc:creator: Kevin Upthegrove
item.description:
5 Minutes of Rum episode 20: 2 Kōloa rums and 2 cocktails

Episode links:

Kauai

Kōloa

Kōloa White

Kōloa Gold

Trader Vic's Tiki Party

Beachbum Berry Remixed

Distilling (E18)

Outrigger (E1)

Grenadine (E14)

Don’s Special Daiquiri (E6)

Trader Vic Daiquiri
2 oz white rum (Koloa White Hawaiian Rum)
1 oz white grapefruit juice (fresh squeezed if at all possible)
1/2 oz fresh squeezed lime juice
1/2 oz simple syrup
1/2 oz maraschino liqueur (1/4 oz with Kōloa)
Combine all ingredients in a cocktail shaker. Shake with ice cubes and strain into a chilled cocktail class.

Red Tide
3/4 oz fresh lime juice
1/2 oz homemade grenadine/pomegranate syrup
1 oz gold Jamaican rum (sub Kōloa Gold Hawaiian rum)
Shake all ingredients with ice cubes in a cocktail shaker. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

item.title: Episode 19: Plantation Original Dark Rum
item.dc:creator: Kevin Upthegrove
item.description:
5 Minutes of Rum episode 19: Plantation Original Dark rum, crushed ice, and the Queen’s Park Swizzle.

Episode links:

Plantation

Elevage

Waring ice crusher

Quararibea turbinata

Quararibea turbinata (USDA)

Queen’s Park Swizzle at RumDood’s site

Trader Vic's Tiki Party

A plastic swizzle is still effective, if not truly the real thing.

Queen’s Park Swizzle, per Trader Vic’s Tiki Party book

1 oz light / silver rum (Don Q Cristal or Cruzan light)
1 oz dark rum (Plantation dark rum)
1 oz 151-proof rum (Cruzan 151)
1/4 oz fresh squeezed lime juice, with a half lime shell reserved (I’m using 1/2 oz)
Dash of simple syrup (I’m using 1/2 oz)
Dash of Angostura bitters

Fill a Collins glass with crushed ice. Add all ingredients except for the half lime shell. Swizzle with swizzle stick or a bar spoon and allow the ice to partially dissolve. Re-fill with more crushed ice and continue to swizzle until the glass frosts over. Add lime shell and top with more crushed ice if needed. Garnish with mint sprig. For an alternate fancee presentation, omit 151 rum and bitters until the cocktail is built and glass is frosted over. Top with 151 and bitters, add mint, and serve. Cocktail should be stirred before drinking. Or not, and finish strong with the overproof on ice.

Queen’s Park Swizzle, 5 Minutes of Rum endorsed version:

3 oz Plantation Original Dark rum
1/2 oz fresh squeezed lime juice, with a half lime shell reserved
1/2 oz simple syrup
2 dashes of Angostura bitters

Fill a Collins glass with crushed ice. Add all ingredients except for the half lime shell. Swizzle with swizzle stick or a bar spoon and allow the ice to partially dissolve. Re-fill with more crushed ice and continue to swizzle until the glass frosts over. Add lime shell and top with more crushed ice if needed. Garnish with mint sprig and 2 more dashes of Angostura bitters.

Queen’s Blood Swizzle

When blood oranges are in season, try this variant.

1 oz silver puerto rican rum
1 oz Plantation dark rum
1 oz Lemon Hart 151 rum
1/2 oz fresh squeezed blood orange juice
1/2 oz simple syrup
1 dash Angostura bitters

Fill a Collins glass with crushed ice. Add all ingredients. Swizzle with swizzle stick or a bar spoon and allow the ice to partially dissolve. Re-fill with more crushed ice and continue to swizzle until the glass frosts over. Top with more crushed ice as needed. Garnish with mint sprig and peel from blood orange.
item.itunes:author: Kevin Upthegrove
item.itunes:subtitle: Plantation Original Dark rum, crushed ice, and the Queen’s Park Swizzle.
item.itunes:summary: Notes on rum, a few minutes at a time. Exploring rum as a spirit as well as an ingredient in both new and classic tiki cocktail recipes. Rum not included.

item.title: Episode 18: Montanya Platino
item.dc:creator: Kevin Upthegrove
item.description:
5 Minutes of Rum episode 18: US distillery Montanya’s Platino rum, a brief mention of bitters, and The Man with the Golden Rum.

Episode links:

Montanya Distillers
Montanya Platino rum
Distilling process
Interview with Karen Hoskin
Distillery video (YouTube)
Fee Brothers Old Fashioned Aromatic Bitters

 

The Man With the Golden Rum

1 oz Montanya Platino
1 oz Appleton VX
3/4 oz fresh lime juice
1/2 oz white grapefruit juice (fresh if available)
1/2 oz simple syrup
1/2 oz apricot brandy (Marie Brizard if available, otherwise use Bols)
Dash of Fee’s Old Fashioned Aromatic Bitters (use caution, a few drops is all that's needed)

Shake with ice cubes and pour unstrained into a double old-fashioned glass or a tiki mug. I didn’t garnish it at the seminar, but a sprig of fresh mint would not be unwelcome.

item.title: Episode 17: The Cup of Cheer
item.dc:creator: Kevin Upthegrove
item.description:
5 Minutes of Rum episode 17: How about a nice holiday punch?

Episode links:

David Wondrich's Punch: The Delights (and Dangers) of the Flowing Bowl
5 Minutes of Rum episode 1
5 Minutes of Rum episode 2
5 Minutes of Rum episode 3
5 Minutes of Rum episode 6
5 Minutes of Rum episode 8

Lemur tea

Ingredients

Cup of Cheer

1 oz Coruba dark Jamaican rum
1 oz Plantation 5 year Barbados rum
1 oz lime juice
1/2 oz honey mix
1/2 oz demerara sugar syrup
1 oz lemur tea (Trader Joe's Vanilla & Cinnamon Black Tea, with a lemur on the box)


For a single serving, shake with ice cubes in a boston shaker and pour unstrained into a double old-fashioned glass. Garnish with a cinnamon stick.


For a punch, multiply each ingredient by the total servings desired. Serve from a bowl with an ice block. Ice the punch cups individually when serving. Garnish with a cinnamon stick.
item.itunes:author: Kevin Upthegrove
item.itunes:subtitle: How about a nice holiday punch?
item.itunes:summary: Notes on rum, a few minutes at a time. Exploring rum as a spirit as well as an ingredient in both new and classic tiki cocktail recipes. Rum not included.

item.title: Episode 16: Zaya rum
item.dc:creator: Kevin Upthegrove
item.description:
5 Minutes of Rum episode 16: Zaya rum, cinnamon syrup and La Trinidad.

Episode links:

Infinium spirits
Zaya rum
Zaya rum (Hand Selected Spirits)
Zaya (Ministry of Rum) 
BG Reynolds cinnamon syrup
Kaiser Penguin cinnamon syrup
Bottles for syrups at Cost Plus World Market

Ceylon cinnamon.

Cinnamon syrup

3 cinnamon sticks (ceylon if available)

2 cups sugar

1 cup water

Break up cinnamon sticks into small pieces. Combine with sugar and water in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a simmer, heat until sugar dissolves. Cover and simmer for 2 minutes. Remove from heat, leave covered. Let sit for 2 hours. Strain through metal strainer or cheesecloth. Pour into syrup bottle and add 0.5 oz light rum to help stabilize. Store in refrigerator. 

La Trinidad

2 oz Zaya rum

1 oz fresh lime juice

1/2 oz cinnamon syrup

1 dash angosture bitters

Add all ingredients to a cocktail shaker. Shake well with ice cubes. Strain into a cocktail glass.
item.itunes:author: Kevin Upthegrove
item.itunes:subtitle: Zaya rum, cinnamon syrup and La Trinidad
item.itunes:summary: Notes on rum, a few minutes at a time. Exploring rum as a spirit as well as an ingredient in both new and classic tiki cocktail recipes. Rum not included.

item.title: Episode 15: Smith & Cross Jamaican rum
item.dc:creator: Kevin Upthegrove
item.description:
5 Minutes of Rum episode 15: Smith & Cross Jamaican rum, pimento liqueur, and Black River Punch. 

Episode links:

Haus Alpenz

Smith & Cross Traditional Jamaican rum

Allspice (wikipedia)

Aeropress

Black River Punch article on Lowbrow Literati

Beachbum Berry Remixed

5 Minutes of Rum E1

5 Minutes of Rum E6 

5 Minutes of Rum E8 

5 Minutes of Rum E9 

5 Minutes of Rum E11 

 

Allspice tree

Pimento Liqueur

1/4 cup dried whole allspice berries

1 (one) 750 ml bottle of light Virgin Islands rum

2 cups demerara sugar

1 cup water

Grind the allspice berries to the consistency of ground coffee. Combine in a saucepan with 1 cup of the light rum and bring just to a boil. Remove from heat and stir. Funnel into an empty rum bottle with grounds and fill 3/4 of the way with more of the light rum. Cap and let it sit for 2 weeks, shaking once a day.

After 2 weeks, remove from bottle and strain through cheesecloth. Then filter 2 more times through unbleached paper coffee filters or twice through an aeropress. Make a demerara sugar syrup with the 2 cups sugar and 1 cup water. Heat until sugar is dissolved. Combine equal parts of this sugar and the pimento rum, bottle, and let sit for at least a month. 

Black River Punch

1 oz fresh lemon juice

1 oz demerara sugar syrup

1/2 oz falernum

1/4 oz pimento liqueur

3 oz Smith & Cross Jamaican rum

2 oz black tea

3/4 cup crushed ice.

Combine all ingredients and flash blend/mix for 5 seconds. Pour into a tall glass or tiki mug and fill with ice cubes. Garnish with fresh grated nutmeg.

This recipe can be scaled up as a punch for a large gathering. The simplest way is to just multiple each ingredient by how many total servings you want. If you want to arrive at a specific fluid total, you'll need to do a little math. For example, to make 1.5 gallons (192 oz), divide the end total ounces desired by the amount of 1 serving (8.5 oz), or ~22 in this case. When scaling up for a punch, regardless of how, omit the ice. Combine the rest of the ingredients in a large vessel (a punch bowl works nicely) and pour into cups filled with ice like a gentleman. A punch cup serving is typically about 4-5 ounces over ice. 

Substitutions: 1.5 oz Smith & Cross and 1.5 oz Appleton VX, or 3 oz Appleton VX, depending on your taste. 1.5 o Smith & Cross and 1.5 oz Batavia Arrack is also a fine choice.
item.itunes:author: Kevin Upthegrove
item.itunes:subtitle: Smith & Cross Jamaican rum, pimento liqueur, and Black River Punch.
item.itunes:summary: Notes on rum, a few minutes at a time. Exploring rum as a spirit as well as an ingredient in both new and classic tiki cocktail recipes. Rum not included.

item.title: Episode 14: Gold Virgin Islands rum, Cruzan Aged Dark rum
item.dc:creator: Kevin Upthegrove
item.description:
5 Minutes of Rum episode 14: Gold Virgin Islands rum, Cruzan Aged Dark rum, homemade grenadine, and the Blood of the Kapu Tiki. 

Episode links: 

5 Minutes of Rum substitutions

Cruzan rum

Cruzan Aged Dark Rum

Cruzan distillery article from Ministry of Rum

BG Reynolds hibiscus grenadine

A Mountain of Crushed Ice hibiscus grenadine

Jeffrey Morgenthaler grenadine

Beachbum Berry Remixed

Tiki+ app

Bottles for syrups at Cost Plus World Market

Bosko art

 

Cruzan Aged Dark rum

Cruzan Aged Dark rum

Pomegranate

Pomegranate

Left: Hibiscus Grenadine from A Mountain of Crushed Ice.

Right: Grenadine from Jeffrey Morgenthaler. 

The Blood of the Kapu TIki

The Blood of the Kapu TIki

Mugs by Bosko.

 Hibiscus Grenadine from A Mountain of Crushed Ice

Grenadine from Jeffrey Morgenthaler 

Blood of the Kapu TIki

3 oz fresh lime juice

3 oz white grapefruit juice

3 oz orange juice

3 oz grenadine

3 oz simple syrup

10 oz Gold Virgin Islands rum

1/2 tsp. Pernod

3 dashes Angostura bitters

Fill a pitcher with crushed ice. Add all ingredients. Stir until the pitcher frosts over. Pour into glasses or tiki mugs. Serves 4-6. Recipe can be cut to a single serving by dividing each ingredient by 3 (use 6 drops of Pernod).

item.title: Episode 13: Ron Matusalem Platino
item.dc:creator: Kevin Upthegrove
item.description:
5 Minutes of Rum episode 13: Silver Dominican Rum, Ron Matusalem Platino, and the Mojito. 

Episode links: 

5 Minutes of Rum substitutions page

E2, silver Puerto Rican rum

Ron Matusalem

Ron Matusalem Platino

Ron Matusalem Platino rum at Ministry of Rum

"And A Bottle Of Rum" by Wayne Curtis

iSi Soda (seltzer) siphon

 

Ron Matusalem Platino

"And A Bottle Of Rum" by Wayne Curtis

Collins glass (14 oz.)

iSi Soda Siphon.

Mojito

Into a 14oz Collins glass, add:

1 ounce demerara sugar syrup

1 1/2 ounces lime juice (fresh!)

6 fresh mint leaves

Gently muddle this together in the glass. The goal is similar to spanking the mint - you want to break some cells to release the mint's oil but not shred it.

Add:

2 ounces Dominican Republic silver rum (Ron Matusalem Platino)

Stir to combine.

Fill 3/4 of the way with ice, stir until glass frosts.

Top with soda. Stir again to combine.

item.title: Episode 11: Wray & Nephew Overproof Rum
item.dc:creator: Kevin Upthegrove
item.description:
5 Minutes of Rum episode 11: Wray & Nephew overproof rum, falernum, and The Hawaiian Eye.

Episode links:

 J Wray & Nephew official

J Wray & Nephew UK site

Wray & Nephew at the Ministry of Rum

Ting (wikipedia)

Velvet Falernum

BG Reynolds falernum

Fee Brothers falernum

SnugHarbor falernum

Falernum recipe at PostProhibition.com

Stopper bottles for syrups

Beachbum Berry Remixed

Falernum components (or COM-ponents as you say)

Infused Wray & Nephew.

Final falernum prep.

Bottled falernum

The (modified) Hawaiian Eye

Falernum #9

6 oz Wray & Nephew Overproof White Rum

Zest of 9 limes with no white pith

40 whole cloves

1 1/2 oz (by weight) peeled and chopped fresh ginger

2 tablespoons blanched, slivered almonds

14 oz 1:1 simple syrup.

3/4 teaspoon almond extract

4 1/2 oz fresh lime juice, strained

Toast cloves and almonds in 350 degree oven for 5-7 minutes or until they begin to get aromatic. 

Combine the rum, lime zest, cloves, almonds and ginger in a sealed mason jar, letting mixture soak for 24 hours. 

After 24 hours. strain this through moistened cheesecloth, squeeze out all the liquids. 

Create a 1:1 ratio simple syrup from 1.5 cups of sugar and 1.5 cups of warm tap water. Shake or stir until sugar is dissolved. This should yield a little more than 14 oz. 

Add the almond extract, sugar syrup, and lime juice to the rum mixture. Stir to combine. Bottle, refrigerate and amaze your friends. 

 

The (modified) Hawaiian Eye

1/2 oz lime juice

1/2 oz falernum

1/2 oz simple syrup

1/2 oz Wray & Nephew Overproof rum

1 oz Gold Puerto Rican rum (sub Gold Virgin Islands rum)

1 cup crushed ice

Combine all ingredients and blend for 5 seconds. Pour unstrained into a tiki mug, tulip glass, or pilsner glass. garnish with mint.
item.itunes:author: Kevin Upthegrove
item.itunes:subtitle: Wray & Nephew overproof rum, falernum, and The Hawaiian Eye.

item.title: Episode 10: Spiced rum
item.dc:creator: Kevin Upthegrove
item.description:
5 Minutes of Rum episode 10: Spiced rum, infusing your own spiced rum, and the Henry & John cocktail.

Episode links: 

 Drinks International Millionaires Club report for 2013 

Zen Tiki Lounge podcast 

ZTL podcast episode 234

ZTL very spicy rum video

Serious Eats spiced rum post

Wall Street Journal spiced rum article

 

Empty Kraken spiced rum bottle.

Infusing spiced rum at home. 

Infusing spiced rum at home.

Straining.

Left: Spice-infused Mt. Gay Eclipse (3 days)

Right: My Gay Eclipse from the bottle. 

Henry and John cocktail.

Henry and John cocktail.

Home-infused spiced rum

To a good bottle of amber aged rum such as Mt. Gay Eclipse, add:

1 vanilla bean, split lengthwise

1 4-5 inch length of orange peel with all white pith removed

1 cinnamon stick, cracked

3 cloves

5 all-spice berries, cracked

5 whole black peppercorns, cracked

1/4 tsp grated nutmeg

2 pieces of fresh, peeled ginger approximately the size of a quarter

Seal the bottle and store in a cool dark place. Turn the bottle upside-down and then right-side up once a day. On day 2, sample the rum. If any particular flavors are starting to dominate (and that's not desired), strain the bottle through a wire mesh strainer, remove the spice in question, and return everything else to the bottle. Between day 3 and 5, strain completely and pour rum back into the bottle. If desired, re-add a spice or 2. Leaving the spiced in longer will result in a stronger flavor. Just be sure to sample as it infuses. It's much easier to add flavor than to remove it. 

 

Henry and John (Martin Cate) 

3/4 ounce fresh lime juice

2 dashes Angostura bitters

2 dashes orange bitters

2 ounces quality spiced rum (like your own!)

1 ounce demerara sugar syrup

2 ounces soda water

Orange peel spiral and mint for garnish

Combine all ingredients except soda in a shaker with ice. Shake. Stir in soda water, then strain into an ice-filled Collins glass with an orange peel spiral running through it. Top with mint. A swizzle wouldn't hurt either.
item.itunes:author: Kevin Upthegrove
item.itunes:subtitle: Spiced rum, infusing your own spiced rum, and the Henry & John cocktail.
item.itunes:summary: Notes on rum, a few minutes at a time. Exploring rum as a spirit as well as an ingredient in both new and classic tiki cocktail recipes. Rum not included.

Bar blender / milkshake mixer. 

Hart of Darkness

 Hart of Darkness

Hart of Darkness

1/2 oz fresh lime juice

1/2 oz passion fruit syrup

1/2 oz honey mix

3/4 oz soda water

1 1/2 oz Lemon Hart 151 rum

1/4 oz lemon juice

8 oz crushed ice (1 cup) 

Combine all ingredients into a blender. Blend on high speed for 5 seconds. Pour into a Collins glass. Add ice cubes to fill.

item.title: Episode 8: An Introduction to Demrara rum, with El Dorado 5 year rum

item.description:

El Dorado 5 year rum

Demerara sugar

Demerara sugar syrup

Bar swizzles

The Noa Noa

The Noa Noa

The Noa Noa

Demerara sugar syrup

In a medium saucepan, combine 1 cup demerara sugar with 1/2 cup cold water. Stir over very low heat until the sugar is dissolved. Don't bring to a full boil. Remove from heat, cool in pan, and transfer to a syrup bottle. Add 1/2 ounce silver Puerto Rican rum as a stabilizer.

The Noa Noa

1 oz fresh lime juice

1/2 oz demerara sugar syrup

4 to 6 mint leaves

3 oz Demerara rum

Swizzle everything in a double old-fashioned glass half-filled with crushed ice for ~30 seconds. Add more crushed ice to fill. Swizzle again until a frost forms on the outside of the glass. Garnish with a mint sprig and half a spent lime shell. Add your favorite restaurant or bar swizzle.

Trader Vic's Mai Tai

item.title: Episode 6: Gold Jamaican rum
item.dc:creator: Kevin Upthegrove
item.description:
5 Minutes of Rum episode 6: More on Jamaican rum, Appleton V/X, honey in cocktails, and Don's Special Daiquiri.

Episode links:

Honey

Bottles for syrups at Cost Plus World Market

Appleton V/X

Rum and chocolate - Tki Oasis 9

Honey mix (syrup)

Don's Special Daquiri

Episodes 2, 3, and 6 in a single cocktail.

Honey mix

In a medium saucepan, bring together equal parts (by volume) honey and water over very low heat just until combined. Very little heat is required; don't cook the honey. Bottle it in olive oil bottles and add a small amount of silver rum to help stabilize and prevent crystallization.

Don's Special Daiquiri

1/2 oz fresh lime juice

1/2 oz passion fruit syrup

1/2 oz honey mix

1/2 oz silver Puerto Rican rum

1 oz gold Jamaican rum

Combine the ingredients in a cocktail shaker with ice cubes. Shake, then strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

'Ti Punch

'Ti Punch

'Ti Punch

A template, not a recipe. Adjust to taste.

In an old-fashioned glass:

Squeeze a quarter of a lime, drop in the spend shell.

Add 1/4 oz cane or simple syrup

Add 2 oz rhum agricole

Swizzle together in glass to combine. Add an ice cube and swizzle again.

Sip, and contemplate adjustments for your next 'Ti Punch.

item.title: Episode 3: Dark Jamaican rum
item.dc:creator: Kevin Upthegrove
item.description:
5 Minutes of Rum episode 3: Dark Jamaican rum, Coruba Dark Jamaican rum, passion fruit syrup, and the Trader Vic Grog cocktail.

Episode links:

Regional variations of rum

Solera

Coruba rum

Coruba Dark Jamaican rum: Ministry of Rum

A Mountain of Crushed Ice passion fruit recipe

BG Reynolds passion fruit syrup

Monin passion fruit syrup

Beachbum Berry Remixed

Trader Vic's Tiki Party

Coruba Dark Jamaican rum

Passion fruit

Preparing passion fruit syrup

Preparing passion fruit syrup

Bottled passion fruit syrup

Double old-fashioned glass (Trader Vic's)

Trader Vic Grog

Trader Vic Grog

Passion fruit syrup

In a medium saucepan, combine 1 cup of sugar with between 3/4 cup - 1 cup of cold water. Stir over very low heat until sugar is dissolved and begins to simmer. Split 3-5 passion fruits in half, remove the fruit and seeds inside, and add to the simmering sugar mixture. Stir and keep simmering over low heat for 2-5 minutes. Remove from heat, and leave standing for 1.5-2 hours. Transfer to a syrup bottle and add 1/2 ounce silver Puerto Rican rum as a stabilizer.

Trader Vic Grog

1 oz fresh lemon juice

1 oz pineapple juice

1 oz passion fruit syrup

2 oz Dark Jamaican rum

1 dash Angostura bitters

Combine the ingredients in a cocktail shaker with 1 cup crushed or cubed ice. Shake and pour unstrained into a double old-fashioned glass. Add more ice to fill. Garnish with mint.

The Daiquiri

Simple syrup

In a medium saucepan, combine 1 cup sugar with 1/2 - 3/4 cup cold water. Stir over very low heat until the sugar is dissolved. Don't bring to a full boil. Remove from heat, cool in pan, and transfer to a syrup bottle. Add 1/2 ounce silver Puerto Rican rum as a stabilizer. 

The Daiquiri

2 oz silver Puerto Rican rum

1 oz fresh lime juice

1/2 oz simple syrup

Combine the ingredients in a cocktail shaker with ice cubes. Shake, then strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
